page.title: 20SCHOOLS MUSIC FESTIVAL.
page.content: The Spilsby and District School's Music Festival began in 1950, being held originally in the Methodist Church, Spilsby and then the Franklin Sec. School, Spilsby. The Festival's numbers grew so that it is now held on 2 nights annually in the New Town Hall Halton Rd. Spilsby. The aim is to draw Junior Schools (especially small country primaries) to enjoy music as one group, and in 1985 also includes sec. school children; in singing, instrumental compositions and accompaniment, and a band. A different theme for the music is chosen each year; 1985's being "Songs of Travel" including "Westering Home"- a Scottish Song chosen by Halton Holegate School. Eleven schools took part altogether. Hon. Secretary is Miss F.O. Malt, Chairman E.W. Willerton, Accompanist R.E. Elliott.
